intro: Sterculia, commonly known as the "Australian chestnut," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. The plants typically have broad, palmately lobed leaves and produce showy, clustered flowers in shades of yellow or red. Sterculia species are valued for their ornamental beauty and have been used in traditional medicine and as a source of timber.
